trans-unit.source: Provides a base implementation of a toolbox item.
<xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is a base class for toolbox items that can be displayed in the toolbox of a design-time environment.
A toolbox item typically represents a component to create when invoked on a design mode document.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class provides the methods and properties needed to provide the toolbox with the display properties for the toolbox item, to create a component or components when used, and to serialize and deserialize itself for persistence within the toolbox database.

An instance of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class can be configured with a name, bitmap, and type to create, without creating a class that derives from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class also provides a base class for custom toolbox item implementations.
A custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> can create multiple components.

To implement a custom toolbox item, you must derive from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> and override the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Serialize%2A>, and <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Deserialize%2A> methods.
The following properties and methods must be configured for a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> to function correctly:
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property specifies the label for the toolbox item when displayed in a toolbox.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property specifies the fully qualified name of the type of the component that the item creates.

If a derived class creates multiple components, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property may or may not be used, contingent on whether a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method override depends on the value of this property.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.AssemblyName%2A> property specifies the assembly that contains the type of a component that the item creates.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Bitmap%2A> property optionally specifies a bitmap image to display next to the display name for the toolbox item in the toolbox.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Filter%2A> property optionally contains any <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> objects that determine whether the toolbox item can be used on a particular component.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method returns the component instance or instances to insert where this tool is used.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Serialize%2A> method saves the toolbox item to a specified <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Deserialize%2A> method configures the toolbox item from the state information contained in the specified <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Initialize%2A> method configures the toolbox item to create the specified type of component, if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method has not been overridden to behave differently.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Locked%2A> property indicates whether the properties of the toolbox item can be changed.
A toolbox item is typically locked after it is added to a toolbox.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Lock%2A> method locks a toolbox item.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CheckUnlocked%2A> method throws an exception if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Locked%2A> property is `true`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> class that creates the specified type of component.
The type of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> that the toolbox item creates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> was locked.
Gets or sets the name of the assembly that contains the type or types that the toolbox item creates.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.AssemblyName%2A> property specifies the assembly that contains the types of the components to create.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.AssemblyName"></xref> that indicates the assembly containing the type or types to create.
Gets or sets a bitmap to represent the toolbox item in the toolbox.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that represents the toolbox item in the toolbox.
Throws an exception if the toolbox item is currently locked.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CheckUnlocked%2A> method throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Locked%2A> property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is set to `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> is locked.
Gets or sets the company name for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the company for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
Occurs immediately after components are created.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreated> event is raised each time components of this toolbox item are created.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when components are about to be created.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreating> event is raised each time components of the toolbox item are about to be created.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets the component type for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the component type for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
Creates the components that the toolbox item is configured to create, using the specified designer host and default values.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponents%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method to retrieve an array of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> containing the components to create.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> to use when creating the components.
A dictionary of property name/value pairs of default values with which to initialize the component.
An array of created <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
Creates the components that the toolbox item is configured to create.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponents%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method to retrieve an array of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> containing the components to create.
An array of created <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
Creates the components that the toolbox item is configured to create, using the specified designer host.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponents%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method to retrieve an array of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> containing the components to create.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> to use when creating the components.
An array of created <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
Creates a component or an array of components when the toolbox item is invoked.
If `host` is not `null`, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method adds the new components to the designer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> to host the toolbox item.
An array of created <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
Creates an array of components when the toolbox item is invoked.
If `host` is not `null`, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method adds the new components to the designer.
The designer host to use when creating components.
A dictionary of property name/value pairs of default values with which to initialize the component.
An array of created <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Reflection.AssemblyName"></xref> for the toolbox item.
The assembly name describes the assembly information needed to load the toolbox item's type.
An array of <xref href="System.Reflection.AssemblyName"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the description for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the description for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
Loads the state of the toolbox item from the specified serialization information object.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to load from.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that indicates the stream characteristics.
Gets or sets the display name for the toolbox item.
This <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property indicates the string that is displayed for the toolbox item in the toolbox.

By default, the base <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class sets its <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property to a short form of the fully qualified type name specified by the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property.
The display name for the toolbox item.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> instances are equal.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the filter that determines whether the toolbox item can be used on a destination component.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Filter%2A> property collection contains <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> objects that specify the policy that the design-time environment uses to determine whether a toolbox item can be used on the destination component.

For more information on restricting the scope in which a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> can be used, see the documentation for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> class.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute"></xref> objects.
Filters a property value before returning it.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.FilterPropertyValue%2A> method enables a property to always clone values, or to provide a default value when none exists.
The name of the property to filter.
The value against which to filter the property.
A filtered property value.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
Enables access to the type associated with the toolbox item.
The designer host is used to access an implementation of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeResolutionService> interface.
However, the loaded type is not added to the list of references in the designer host.
The designer host to query for <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeResolutionService"></xref>.
The type associated with the toolbox item.
Creates an instance of the specified type, optionally using a specified designer host and assembly name.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> for the current document.
This can be `null`.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.AssemblyName"></xref> that indicates the assembly that contains the type to load.
This can be `null`.
The name of the type to create an instance of.
A value indicating whether or not to add a reference to the assembly that contains the specified type to the designer host's set of references.
An instance of the specified type, if it can be located.
typeName is not specified.
Initializes the current toolbox item with the specified type to create.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Initialize%2A> method configures the toolbox item to create the specified type, if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method has not been overridden to behave differently.
This method performs the following operations:
Sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.AssemblyName%2A> property to an <xref:System.Reflection.AssemblyName> indicating the assembly of the specified type.
Sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property to a short type name based on the name of the specified type.
Adds any <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> attributes found on the specified type to the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Filter%2A> property collection.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that the toolbox item creates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> was locked.
Gets a value indicating whether the toolbox item is transient.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.IsTransient%2A> property defaults to `false`.
`true`, if this toolbox item should not be stored in any toolbox database when an application that is providing a toolbox closes; otherwise, `false`.
Locks the toolbox item and prevents changes to its properties.
The properties of a toolbox item cannot be changed when it is locked.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> is currently locked.
When a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is locked, you cannot adjust its properties.
`true` if the toolbox item is locked; otherwise, `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreated"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreated%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreated> event.
This method is called after a toolbox item is invoked to create components and the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method has returned.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreated%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Raises the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreating"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreating%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreating> event.
This method is called after a toolbox item is invoked to create components, just before the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method is called.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreating%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatingEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Gets or sets the original bitmap that will be used in the toolbox for this item.
This bitmap should be 16x16 pixels and should be used in the Visual Studio toolbox, not on the design surface.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that represents the toolbox item in the toolbox.
Gets a dictionary of properties.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Properties%2A> property dictionary becomes read-only after the toolbox item has been locked.

Values in the properties dictionary are validated through the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ValidatePropertyValue%2A> method, and default values are obtained from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetDefaultProperty%2A> method.
A dictionary of name/value pairs (the names are property names and the values are property values).
Saves the state of the toolbox item to the specified serialization information object.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to save to.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that indicates the stream characteristics.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
Gets or sets the fully qualified name of the type of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> that the toolbox item creates when invoked.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property specifies the fully qualified type name of the type of component to create.
The fully qualified type name of the type of component that this toolbox item creates.
Validates that an object is of a given type.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ValidatePropertyType%2A> method is called as a helper method to the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ValidatePropertyValue%2A> method.
The name of the property to validate.
Optional value against which to validate.
The expected type of the property.
`true` to allow `null`; otherwise, `false`.
value is `null`, and allowNull is `false`.
value is not the type specified by expectedType.
Validates a property before it is assigned to the property dictionary.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ValidatePropertyValue%2A> method is called whenever a value is set in the property dictionary.
With this method, you can change the value of an object before committing it, or reject it by throwing an exception.
The name of the property to validate.
The value against which to validate.
The value used to perform validation.
value is `null`, and propertyName is "IsTransient".
Gets the version for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the version for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.

For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination (see <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>) for this serialization.
